questions.question: A hydraulic press has a ram of 15 cm diameter and plunger of 1.5 cm. It is required to lift a mass of 1000 kg. The force required on plunger is nearly equal to
questions.explanation: By Archimedes principle, F₁/A₁ = F₂/A₂. F₁ = F₂ × (A₁/A₂). F₁ = (1000kg × g) × (π(1.5)²/4) / (π(15)²/4) = 10000 × (1.5/15)² = 10000 × (1/100) = 100N.

questions.question: If the stream function is given by Ψ = 3xy, then the velocity at a point (2, 3) will be
questions.explanation: Given stream function ψ = 3xy. Velocity components are u = ∂ψ/∂y = 3x and v = -∂ψ/∂x = -3y. At point (2, 3), u = 3(2) = 6 and v = -3(3) = -9. Resultant velocity = √(u² + v²) = √(6² + (-9)²) = √(36 + 81) = √117 ≈ 10.82 units.

questions.question: The correct sequence of the centrifugal pump components through which the fluid flows is
options: Impeller, Suction pipe, Foot valve and strainer, Deliver pipe
Foot valve and strainer, Suction pipe, Impeller, Deliver pipe
Impeller, Suction pipe, Deliver pipe, Foot valve and strainer
Suction pipe, Deliver pipe, Impeller, Foot valve and strainer
questions.answer: Foot valve and strainer, Suction pipe, Impeller, Deliver pipe
questions.explanation: The sequence of the centrifugal pump is 'Foot valve and strainer, suction pipe, Impeller, Delivery pipe'.

questions.question: The relation PV^γ = constant, where γ is the ratio of the specific heats of ideal gas, is applicable to
questions.explanation: PV^γ = constant. Where, γ = Cp/Cv. The above relation is valid for adiabatic & reversible process only for ideal gas.

questions.question: Across a normal shock
options: static pressure and the static temperature rise
questions.answer: static pressure and the static temperature rise
questions.explanation: The shock wave is perpendicular to the flow direction it is called a normal shock. Across a normal shock static pressure and the static temperature rise almost instantaneously.
